item.title: TalkSwitch Supports both VoIP and Legacy PBX
item.description:
Choosing between a traditional phone system (analog or digital TDM PBX) and a newer VoIP system can be tough. TalkSwitch offers a solution by supporting both technologies. For example, the TalkSwitch 244vs desktop PBX handles 2 incoming lines, 4 extensions for analog phones, and features like voicemail and music on hold. It also supports 10 remote extensions, allowing cell phones, home phones, and phones on other systems to connect by dialing a 3-digit extension...

item.title: Hosted Telecommunications from Packet8
item.description:
If your company is outgrowing its current phone system but a full-blown PBX system seems like overkill, there’s a middle ground: hosted telecommunications. Instead of housing your own PBX equipment, hosted solutions put that functionality in the cloud, similar to website hosting. You get all the features of an in-house system without the bulky hardware. Your office phones connect to the provider’s equipment through your broadband connection. Packet8 is a leading provider of hosted telecom for small to medium businesses...

item.title: How The Cloud Provides Virtualization For The SMB
item.description:
Virtualization has been a popular topic for large businesses for a while. It allows them to maximize their existing resources, turning one server into multiple virtual ones and distributing heavy workloads across platforms. But can smaller businesses also benefit from virtualization? The answer is a resounding yes, thanks to the cloud. The cloud’s power lies in virtualization, enabling it to function as a massive data center accessible to numerous users. By efficiently utilizing virtualization, cloud providers can create an illusion of infinite resources, making each user feel like the sole user...
